_________ ____ Literary art goes beyond the usual professional, academic, journalistic, and other technical form of writing. It focuses on writing using a unique style, not following a specific form or norm. It may include both fiction and non-fiction such as novels, biographies and poems.
__________ uses live performers to present accounts or imaginary events before a live audience.

________ incorporate elements of style and design to everyday items with the aim of increasing their aesthetical value. Artists in this field bring beauty, charm, and comfort into many things that are useful in everyday life
This function of art is used for variety of illness, both physical and mental.

This function of art is product of a particular time and place, an artwork represents the ideas and technology of that specific time and place. As we look back over history, we find in art striking, and in some cases, the only, tangible records of some peoples. The insights we gain into cultures, including our own are enhanced tremendously by such artifacts as paintings, sculptures, poems, plays, and buildings.
This function of art is varied and highly subjective. This means that its function depend on the person- the artist who created the art.

This function of art is considered to have a social function if and when it addresses a particular collective interest as opposed to a personal interest. Political art is a very common example of an art with a social function. Art may convey message of protest, contestation, or whatever message the artist intends his work to carry
This function of art is the easiest to spot and understand. The physical functions of art can be found in artworks that are crafted in order to serve some physical purpose.
__________ - refers to the visual focus or the image that may be extracted from examining the artwork.
__________ - is the meaning that is communicated by the artist or the artwork.

__________ ____This art does not make a reference to the real world, whether it is a person, place, thing, or even a particular event. It is stripped down to visual elements such as shapes, lines, emotion, and even concept.

This level of meaning pertains to the most rudimentary level of meaning for it may be extracted from the identifiable or recognizable forms in the artwork and understanding how these elements relate to one another.

This level of meaning pertains to the acknowledged interpretation of the artwork using motifs, signs, symbols and other cyphers as bases of its meaning. These conventions are established through time, strengthened by recurrent use and wide acceptance by its viewers or audience and scholars who study then.

This level of meaning are consulted, a variety of meaning may arise when a particular work of art is read. These meanings stem from the viewer’s or audience’s circumstances that come into play when engaging with art

always has direction, always moving.
as used in any work of art, may either be straight or curved.

In the most basic classification, colors can be divided into three groups: primary, secondary and tertiary.

____ is the term for the pure spectrum colors commonly referred to by the "color names" - red, orange, yellow, blue, green violet - which appear in the hue circle or rainbow. Theoretically all hues can be mixed from three basic hues, known as primaries.
A _______ _____ is an abstract illustrative organization of color hues around a circle, that shows relationships between primary, secondary, and tertiary colors, etc.

______ is the element that deals more directly with the sense of touch.It has to do with the characteristics of surfaces which can be rough or smooth, fine or coarse, shiny or dull, plain or irregular.
_______ expresses the idea of how a surface might feel. For example, a painting of a blanket might convey the idea that the blanket is soft.
______ is texture that can actually be felt. For example, a ceramic bowl might feature a carved texture that could be felt when holding that bowl.
______ deals with the effect of distance upon the appearance of objects, by means of which the eye judges spatial relationships.
______ perspective is the representation of an appearance of distance by means of converging lines.
______ perspective is the representation of relative distances of objects by gradations of tone or color.
______ refers to how the artist fills the surface on which a work of art is created. It can also refer to the expression of depth within a work of art.
______ as an element of art, refers to distances or areas around, between or within components of a piece.
______ can be positive (white or light) or negative (black or dark),open or closed, shallow or deep and two-dimensional or three-dimensional.

Form refers to a three-dimensional object. As such, form is an art term that is only applied to those artworks that are three-dimensional, such as sculpture and pottery.
